DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine time progression patient glioblastoma multiforme anaplastic astrocytoma ( primary presentation ) treat surgical resection , radiotherapy , T cell immunotherapy initial therapy . II . Determine toxic effect therapy patient . OUTLINE : Patients vaccinate irradiated , autologous tumor cell plus sargramostim ( GM-CSF ) intradermally near drain lymph node groin axillary region . This follow 3 consecutive day intradermal injection GM-CSF , directly vaccine site . Enlarged lymph node remove 7-10 day later activate staphylococcal enterotoxin A ( SEA ) interleukin-2 ( IL-2 ) . T cell expand ex vivo approximately 10 day . 1-2 day prior infusion , oral cyclophosphamide administer one time dose . The lymphocyte infusion administer intravenously . Based availability , patient may receive vaccine boost additional injection irradiate autologous tumor cell thaw original , cryopreserved collection . Patients follow 1 month every 2 month thereafter . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A maximum 40 patient accrue study within 2 year .
